snippet: As long as General Motors’ share price stays down, the automaker is likely to be saddled with its government stakeholder.
abstract: General Motors, with the Treasury Department still owning 26 percent of the company three years after its taxpayer bailout and bankruptcy, remains saddled with restrictions and lingering image problems in the eyes of some consumers; unless GM's share price rises significantly, the chances are slim the Obama administration will sell its 500 million shares before the November election.
lead_paragraph: As long as General Motors’ share price stays down, the automaker is likely to be saddled with its government stakeholder.
